      • DEFAULT_BLOCK_DELIMITERS

        public static final java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character>> DEFAULT_BLOCK_DELIMITERS
        Pairs of strings that surround a section of code that is considered as a whole.

    • Method Detail

      • nestedRegex

        public static java.lang.String nestedRegex(java.lang.String prefix,
                                           java.lang.String suffix)

        Should be used when:

        • You want to find a pair of block delimiters, and you need to account for nested blocks.
        • You want to find something only at the top level: e.g., a comma-separated list that can include array initializations, like "a, b, new int[]{1, 2, 3}, d", where you want to find only the commas outside the {}s.

        prefix and suffix are regexes that are used to find a potentially valid block. The returned regex will match anything starting with prefix and ending with suffix; #evaluateNestedRegexMatch(List, String, String, String, String...) should be used to determine the true match, which may or may not be one you're looking for.

        See Also:
        evaluateNestedRegexMatch(List, String, String, String, String...)

      • evaluateNestedRegexMatch

        public static MacroUtil.NestedRegexResult evaluateNestedRegexMatch(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character>> blockDelimiters,
                                                                   java.lang.String openDelim,
                                                                   java.lang.String closeDelim,
                                                                   java.lang.String match,
                                                                   java.lang.String... toFind)
                                                            throws MalformedMacroException

        Evaluate the match of a pattern returned by nestedRegex(String, String). openDelim and closeDelim are the pair of delimiters that contain the match; this method determines whether or not they're matching delimiters, and truncates the match to the first instance of closeDelim.

        All of the parameters of this method take literal strings, not regexes.

        Parameters:
        match - the string that matched between the prefix and suffix; the capturing group between those in the prefix and those in the suffix.
        toFind - a list of strings to find in the top level of the match
        Throws:
        MalformedMacroException
        See Also:
        nestedRegex(String, String)

      • evaluateNestedRegexMatch

        public static MacroUtil.NestedRegexResult evaluateNestedRegexMatch(java.lang.String openDelim,
                                                                   java.lang.String closeDelim,
                                                                   java.lang.String match,
                                                                   java.lang.String... toFind)
                                                            throws MalformedMacroException
        Calls evaluateNestedRegexMatch(List, String, String, String, String...) with the DEFAULT_BLOCK_DELIMITERS.
        Throws:
        MalformedMacroException

      • isPartOfIdentifier

        public static boolean isPartOfIdentifier(MacroUtil.IdentifierPartLocation location,
                                         java.lang.String code,
                                         java.util.regex.MatchResult match)
        Determines whether or not the given match is part of a Java identifier in the given code (in which case it may not actually be a proper match of the macro). That is, determines whether or not the code points before and/or after the given match are parts of Java identifiers.
        Parameters:
        location - where to look for Java identifier parts.
        code - the code in which the given match was found.
        match - a potential match.
        Returns:
        whether or not one or more Java identifier parts were found.

      • replaceNames

        public static java.lang.String replaceNames(java.lang.String replacementString,
                                            java.lang.String... names)
        Replaces named group references of the form "${name}" in a replacement string with their equivalent Java-6-compatible group-index references of the form "$i".
        Parameters:
        replacementString - a replacement string containing named group references.
        names - the names used in the string, in the order of their groups (e.g., the first name is the first group, $1).

      • replaceWhitespace

        public static java.lang.String replaceWhitespace(java.lang.String regex)
        Makes single spaces match any amount of whitespace, and double spaces match at least one, unless they're preceded by a backslash.
